title: Toxicity in this game is awful
body: So I'm playing in a blind match as support. Adc runs his face into draven and sona and dies for free. He then proceeds to spam my choice of keystone as if that's the reason he died. Dude continues feeding and apparently that's my fault too. I leave lane thinking this is probably a lost cause, help get a kill mid, help get a kill top, bot continues feeding. Game actually ended up really close but jesus it's sad to see this shit going on. Report me the dude says, apparently it's my fault for not winning his lane for him. Next thing you know ppl gonna blame their support for every cs that they miss too lmao.

What did they do to deserve to be banned? Why would you expect to keep playing a game that censors their speech and tries to control their behavior? People play games to get away from that shit irl. The game that retains it's rapport with its fanbase rather than becoming a shitshow like league and overwatch and other games of its ilk, are the ones that give the player base the freedom that they want. That includes telling complainers to take it up with god, or to go play another game if you don't like it. 

Have you ever met a pleaser in real life? No one likes them and they get used and disposed of. The same applies to companies that try to be pleasers towards the crowd is the community gets worse and worse and respect for the company becomes zero. Eventually you're gonna try to please a bunch of people who hate you, while alienating the people who you actually want in your fanbase because they feel like you are either totally incompetent or don't care about your product or fanbase.

Toxicity has nothing to do with "pleasers". I don't think you ever went to a park and shouted "go fuck yourself everyone". 

A match is kinda like a public space. You meet people you don't know, in a place not owned by you. You seriously can't expect that insults should be tolerated in this location, right?
What do you do when you play a pick up game of basketball and one player decides to clown around with his feet?

> [{quoted}](name=Hermetic Fusion,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=rnc7T8WL,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-10T04:38:30.588+0000)
>

Fine, i will humor you:

In a public game, i would go to a referee or one of the umpires and say that one of the players should be taken out of the court, on account of disrupting behaviour.

In a game with friends, i would usually tell him to stop screwing around, or he would be thrown out. Or i would punch him in the face, but that's only if i lost my temper.

Honestly I think that's a primary source of the toxicity being worse than it could be. Everyone is wronged on some level, or at least in their own mind at worst case scenario, but the people getting punished are the ones getting report brigaded apparently like a bot does it and it can't make decisions based on human conduct, how could it. You don't get people choosing to behave better by punishing them for not behaving how you want them to, you get it by giving them an environment to make their own decisions on their own. Trying to tighten the noose around their throat is just gonna make most people resentful. All you end up is snowflake culture and rampant toxicity.
Do they not ban for toxicity?
